intro: Ligusticum pilgerianum, commonly known as the Pacific yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
